title: Frederick

|   | A svelte fighter-mage with a gold-rimmed monocle, a keen sense of tradition, and the blood of the gods running through his veins. He's here looking for a worthy opponent, but he's yet to find one.***“I thoroughly disapprove of duels. I consider them unwise and I know they are dangerous. Also, sinful. If a man should challenge me, I would take him kindly and forgivingly by the hand and lead him to a quiet retired spot and kill him.” -Mark Twain, \_Autobiography of Mark Twain\_. 1924. |

## Contents

- [1 Useful Info](#Useful_Info)
- [2 Location](#Location)
- [3 Spells](#Spells)
- [4 Tips & Tricks](#Tips_.26_Tricks)
- [5 History](#History)

## Useful Info

**Frederick the Flawless** is a dangerous [unique](/Unique "Unique") [demigod](/Demigod_\(monster\) "Demigod (monster)") caster. Although he's only fair in melee combat, the damage output of his spells is on par with [Cerebov](/Cerebov "Cerebov").

## Location

- [The Depths](/The_Depths "The Depths"):3-4
- [The Vaults](/The_Vaults "The Vaults"):2-5
- [The Crypt](/The_Crypt "The Crypt")

## Spells

| Spell set I |                                                                      |                                                     |
| :---------- | -------------------------------------------------------------------- | --------------------------------------------------- |
| Slot1       | [Plasma Beam](/Plasma_Beam "Plasma Beam") (2x3d26)                   | [Wizard flag](/Spell_slot_flags "Spell slot flags") |
| Slot2       | [Bombard](/Bombard "Bombard") (3d38)                                 | [Wizard flag](/Spell_slot_flags "Spell slot flags") |
| Slot3       | [Spellforged Servitor](/Spellforged_Servitor "Spellforged Servitor") | [Wizard flag](/Spell_slot_flags "Spell slot flags") |

## Tips & Tricks

- Frederick's spells can be brutally powerful. If he manages to get a Spellforged Servitor on the field, he essentially becomes twice as deadly. Frederick is an excellent opponent to use those [scrolls of silence](/Scrolls_of_silence "Scrolls of silence") or [phial of floods](/Phial_of_floods "Phial of floods") against. His melee skills may be decent (particularly if he has a weapon with a dangerous brand), but they're much less likely to deal 100+ damage to you in a single turn.
- Alternatively, try to fight him at at extreme long range, popping spells like [Freezing Cloud](/Freezing_Cloud "Freezing Cloud") and then backing away. If you can hit him with a [curare](/Curare "Curare") [dart](/Dart "Dart") first, this [kiting](/Kiting "Kiting") process will be even easier.
- Summons can help block Frederick's Bombard, but they won't stop his Plasma Beam.

## History

- In [0.32](/0.32 "0.32"), Frederick's melee damage will be slightly reduced, 50 -> 44, but he'll get the [Fighter flag](/Fighter_flag "Fighter flag").
- Prior to [0.31](/0.31 "0.31"), Frederick had [Force Lance](/Force_Lance "Force Lance"), [Bolt of Cold](/Bolt_of_Cold "Bolt of Cold"), and [Iron Shot](/Iron_Shot "Iron Shot") instead of Plasma Beam and Bombard. Also, he had less HP, lower HD (21), and a much weaker melee attack (27 damage).
- Prior to [0.25](/0.25 "0.25"), Frederick had [Iskenderun's Mystic Blast](/Iskenderun%27s_Mystic_Blast "Iskenderun's Mystic Blast") instead of [Force Lance](/Force_Lance "Force Lance").
- Prior to [0.16](/0.16 "0.16"), Frederick was known as Frederick the Vigilant, was a [human](/List_of_humans "List of humans") instead of a demigod, and knew [Invisibility](/Invisibility "Invisibility") instead of Spellforged Servitor.
- In early versions of *DCSS*, he was known as Adolf.
html:
Frederick

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Version 0.31: This article may not be up to date for the latest stable release of Crawl.
Frederick @ 
HP 130-263
HD 23
XP 5163
Speed 10
AC 0
EV 16
Will 140
Attack1 50 (hit: plain)


Resistances None
Vulnerabilities None
Habitat Land
Intelligence Human
Uses Weapons & armour
Starting equipment
Open doors
Holiness Natural
Size Medium
Type demigod, demigod
Flags See invisible
Speaks
Warm-blooded
Unique
Male
A svelte fighter-mage with a gold-rimmed monocle, a keen sense of tradition, and the blood of the gods running through his veins. He's here looking for a worthy opponent, but he's yet to find one.

“I thoroughly disapprove of duels. I consider them unwise and I know they are dangerous. Also, sinful. If a man should challenge me, I would take him kindly and forgivingly by the hand and lead him to a quiet retired spot and kill him.”
-Mark Twain, _Autobiography of Mark Twain_. 1924.

Contents

  • 1 Useful Info
  • 2 Location
  • 3 Spells
  • 4 Tips & Tricks
  • 5 History

Useful Info

Frederick the Flawless is a dangerous unique demigod caster. Although he's only fair in melee combat, the damage output of his spells is on par with Cerebov.

Location

  • The Depths:3-4
  • The Vaults:2-5
  • The Crypt

Spells

Spell set I
Slot1 Plasma Beam (2x3d26) Wizard flag
Slot2 Bombard (3d38) Wizard flag
Slot3 Spellforged Servitor Wizard flag

Tips & Tricks

  • Frederick's spells can be brutally powerful. If he manages to get a Spellforged Servitor on the field, he essentially becomes twice as deadly. Frederick is an excellent opponent to use those scrolls of silence or phial of floods against. His melee skills may be decent (particularly if he has a weapon with a dangerous brand), but they're much less likely to deal 100+ damage to you in a single turn.
  • Alternatively, try to fight him at at extreme long range, popping spells like Freezing Cloud and then backing away. If you can hit him with a curare dart first, this kiting process will be even easier.
  • Summons can help block Frederick's Bombard, but they won't stop his Plasma Beam.

History

  • In 0.32, Frederick's melee damage will be slightly reduced, 50 -> 44, but he'll get the Fighter flag.
  • Prior to 0.31, Frederick had Force Lance, Bolt of Cold, and Iron Shot instead of Plasma Beam and Bombard. Also, he had less HP, lower HD (21), and a much weaker melee attack (27 damage).
  • Prior to 0.25, Frederick had Iskenderun's Mystic Blast instead of Force Lance.
  • Prior to 0.16, Frederick was known as Frederick the Vigilant, was a human instead of a demigod, and knew Invisibility instead of Spellforged Servitor.
  • In early versions of DCSS, he was known as Adolf.
Retrieved from "http://crawl.chaosforge.org/index.php?title=Frederick&oldid=80632"

{{version031}}
{{monster info}}

==Useful Info==
'''Frederick the Flawless''' is a dangerous [[unique]] [[demigod (monster)|demigod]] caster. Although he's only fair in melee combat, the damage output of his spells is on par with [[Cerebov]].

==Location==
*[[The Depths]]:3-4
*[[The Vaults]]:2-5
*[[The Crypt]]

{{monster spells}}

==Tips & Tricks==
*Frederick's spells can be brutally powerful. If he manages to get a Spellforged Servitor on the field, he essentially becomes twice as deadly. Frederick is an excellent opponent to use those [[scrolls of silence]] or [[phial of floods]] against. His melee skills may be decent (particularly if he has a weapon with a dangerous brand), but they're much less likely to deal 100+ damage to you in a single turn.
*Alternatively, try to fight him at at extreme long range, popping spells like [[Freezing Cloud]] and then backing away. If you can hit him with a [[curare]] [[dart]] first, this [[kiting]] process will be even easier.
*Summons can help block Frederick's Bombard, but they won't stop his Plasma Beam.

==History==
{{CBA|0.32|Frederick's melee damage will be slightly reduced, 50 -> 44, but he'll get the [[Fighter flag]].}}
*Prior to [[0.31]], Frederick had [[Force Lance]], [[Bolt of Cold]], and [[Iron Shot]] instead of Plasma Beam and Bombard. Also, he had less HP, lower HD (21), and a much weaker melee attack (27 damage).
*Prior to [[0.25]], Frederick had [[Iskenderun's Mystic Blast]] instead of [[Force Lance]].
*Prior to [[0.16]], Frederick was known as Frederick the Vigilant, was a [[list of humans|human]] instead of a demigod, and knew [[Invisibility]] instead of Spellforged Servitor.
*In early versions of ''DCSS'', he was known as Adolf.
